intro: Lithospermum commutatum, commonly known as the rock pepper or narrowleaf lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive blue-green hue, while its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum commutatum is an important plant in ecological studies due to its adaptability to harsh conditions.
